title: minican Republic: Citi Foundation Holds Roundtable on Employment Opportunities for Young People
summary: Santo Domingo, Domincan Republic - As part of its Pathways to Progress initiative, the Citi Foundation is partnering with Junior Achievement Dominicana to present a roundtable discussion about job and growth opportunities for young people in the Dominican labor market. The event, titled "Investment in Youth: Creating Employment Opportunities in the 21st Century Economy," is intended to create a space for dialogue with other organization and sectors of society about critical issues affecting the ability of young people to join the job market in today's economy: skills, entrepreneurship and the technology gap.
tag-1: minican Republic: Citi Foundation Holds Roundtable on Employment Opportunities for Young People
tag-3: Santo Domingo, Domincan Republic – As part of its Pathways to Progress initiative, the Citi Foundation is partnering with Junior Achievement Dominicana to present a roundtable discussion about job and growth opportunities for young people in the Dominican labor market. The event, titled "Investment in Youth: Creating Employment Opportunities in the 21st Century Economy," is intended to create a space for dialogue with other organization and sectors of society about critical issues affecting the ability of young people to join the job market in today's economy: skills, entrepreneurship and the technology gap.
tag-4: Scheduled for Tuesday, August 23 at the JW Marriott, the roundtable will attempt to identify the best ways young people can develop an entrepreneurial mentality, acquire leadership and financial skills and gain entrance to the formal economy through their first job.
tag-5: The discussion will feature key actors representing government agencies, non-profits, academic institutions, the private sector and the country's youth. The big question facing the participants is how to create opportunities that live up to the optimism felt by today's young people and that incorporate the skills they need in a changing world. "This initiative in partnership with Junior Achievement Dominicana is part of Citi's commitment to financial growth and progress in the countries where we operate. In this case, we are aiming to contribute to young Dominicans' development by focusing on their entry into the job market and their access to technology," commented Máximo Vidal, CCO of Citi Dominican Republic.
tag-6: According to World Bank data, 20 million young people in Latin America between the ages of 15 to 24 neither work nor go to school. Nevertheless, a study commissioned by the Citi Foundation reveals, most young people in the region are optimistic, even though this demographic segment lacks a safety net for facing the challenges posed by the current economy.
tag-7: "After years working with young Dominicans, we believe that their entrepreneurial spirit and desire to success are opportunities that our society cannot afford to ignore," said César Asiático, Executive Director of Junior Achievement Dominicana. "Thanks to the vision of organizations such as Citi, JA can offer the tools they need to be entrepreneurs. We are very enthusiastic about this chance to bring other actors to the table to discuss critical aspects in preparing our youth."
tag-8: The Citi Foundation study was conducted by the Economist Intelligence Unit. Titled "Accelerating Pathways," it looked at 35 cities around the world and used surveys to weigh the factors with the most significant impact on young people's development.
tag-9: Pathways to Progress is an initiative offered in a number of countries around the world where Citi operates to contribute to young people's entrepreneurial and financial development. This objective goes hand in hand with the vision of Junior Achievement Dominicana, which develops and implements economic and business education programs for Dominican youth. Its programs in the Dominican Republic include Creando tu Futuro (Creating Your Future), in partnership with Global Fairness Initiative, and Kuepa, which helps young people strengthen their job skills.

tag-12: Junior Achievement Dominicana Junior Achievement Dominicana is a non-profit organization dedicated to developing and implementing economics and business education programs that emphasize the importance of ethics and positive values. The organization's main goal is to develop a spirit of entrepreneurship among children and young people, offering them the inspiration and the tools to attain higher levels of personal development. JA Dominicana benefits more than 30,000 young people every academic year thanks to the support of partner organizations and is a member of JA WORLDWIDE.
